Understate: The claim may understate the existence of a foreign policy network supporting and advising Sen. Sanders, as it ignores the fact that he has consulted with various experts and organizations on foreign policy issues.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or examples to back up the assertion that there is no foreign policy network supporting and advising Sen. Sanders.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that having a foreign policy network supporting and advising a candidate is necessary or expected, without providing any justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that while Sen. Sanders may not have a traditional foreign policy network, he still consults with and receives advice from various individuals and organizations on foreign policy matters.
